intro: Macleania sodiroi, commonly known as the Sodiro's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Loranthaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered together. It relies on a host tree for water and nutrients, while still performing some photosynthesis. Its unique ecological role makes it an important species in the study of plant parasitism and biodiversity.
